thread.title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger confirms when he'll decide on future | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger confirms when he'll decide on future | Metro News

author: Sean Kearns For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger confirms when he'll decide on future | Metro News
text:
Sean Kearns for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 2:26 pm Arsene Wenger’s contract expires this summer (Picture: Getty) 
Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger has revealed he’ll decide on his future at the club in March and April. 
Further question marks were raised over the Frenchman’s time at the club following the side’s 5-1 defeat to Bayern Munich in the first leg of their last-16 Champions League tie on Wednesday. Paul Pogba shows brotherly love after Florentin is forced off injured 
Wenger has six-months to run on his existing deal at the Emirates and he’s yet to commit to a new contract in north London. 
The club’s board maintain they’ll wait until the end of the season until discussing Wenger’s future but the 66-year-old’s confirmed he will decide in March or April. Arsenal were humiliated against Bayern Munich (Picture: Getty) 
‘That’s the problem with age! I’m happy as manager and happy at Arsenal,’ said Wenger, just prior to last night’s game. 
‘[It will be] March or April probably.’ Arsene Wenger in numbers
